inference: The $n$th triangular number is the sum of the first $n$ positive integers.  Thus, the 20th triangular number is $1 + 2 + 3 + \dots + 20$.  This sum can be computed by pairing the first and last terms, the second and second-to-last terms, and so on: $(1 + 20) + (2 + 19) + (3 + 18) + \dots + (10 + 11)$.  There are 10 such pairs, each of which sums to 21, so the 20th triangular number is $10 \cdot 21 = \boxed{210}$. Final Answer: $\boxed{210}$. I hope it is correct.

question:
The $n$th triangular number is the sum of the first $n$ positive integers.  Thus, the 20th triangular number is $1 + 2 + 3 + \dots + 20$.  This sum can be computed by pairing the first and last terms, the second and second-to-last terms, and so on: $(1 + 20) + (2 + 19) + (3 + 18) + \dots + (10 + 11)$.  There are 10 such pairs, each of which sums to 21, so the 20th triangular number is $10 \cdot 21 = \boxed{210}$. Final Answer: $\boxed{210}$. I hope it is correct.
